title: The body of the searched email cannot be viewed.
creator: iss-desk.sana
content:
When I search for emails and click on a message from the search results, I receive an error message saying “Email not found”, and the email body does not appear. However, if I open the same email directly from the Inbox without using the search function, the email content is displayed correctly. I would like to be able to view the email body from the search results as well. Are there any known causes or possible solutions for this issue?

Prerequisite: This concerns behavior after migrating Thunderbird email data from an old device to a Windows 11 PC. Currently, I am only using Thunderbird for viewing emails.

title: How does one export one's private key (secret key) using OpenPGP in Thunderbird in Windows 10
creator: bugzillameow
content:
How does one export one's private key (secret key) using OpenPGP in Thunderbird in Windows 10?

In this directory... C:\Users\meow\AppData\Roaming\Thunderbird\Profiles\yy677g4j.default-release\

I find these files... (I have obfuscated some of the file names) secring.gpg pubring.gpg 0xBBBBBBBBBBBBBB_rev.asc 0xAAAAAAAAAAAAAA_rev.asc 0xCCCCCCCCCCCCC_rev.asc

It seems that the secring.gpg file would contain 3 private keys, corresponding to the 3 public keys shown. I would like to ask how can I create a file containing the private key which corresponds to the "CCCCC..." public key but NOT containing the private key for any other key pair.

Thunderbird's OpenPGP menu allows me to easily export the public key, but does not seem to provide any mechanism for exporting my private key.

Thanks for your advice! ~uxfail

title: Shift F5
creator: itm8b
content:
In einer frischen Thunderbird-Installation (getestet mit 140 ESR und 147) funktioniert der manuelle globale Abruf per Shift + F5 nicht mehr für POP3-Konten.

Konkret: – POP3-Konten sind korrekt eingerichtet – „Beim Starten auf neue Nachrichten prüfen“ aktiv – „Alle X Minuten auf neue Nachrichten prüfen“ aktiv (z. B. 2880 Minuten) – Thunderbird ist online

Erwartetes Verhalten: Shift + F5 bzw. „Alle Konten abrufen“ prüft die POP3-Konten und holt neue Nachrichten ab (wie in früheren Versionen).

Tatsächliches Verhalten: – Shift + F5 bewirkt gar nichts – Kein Abruf, keine Fehlermeldung, keine Statusanzeige – Gleiches Verhalten bei „Alle Konten abrufen“

Wichtig: Der Abruf funktioniert sofort, wenn man per Rechtsklick gezielt ein einzelnes POP3-Konto → „Nachrichten abrufen“ auswählt.

Das zeigt, dass – Server erreichbar sind – Konten korrekt konfiguriert sind – das Problem ausschließlich den globalen manuellen Abruf betrifft

Zusätzlich scheint Shift + F5 inzwischen nur noch Konten zu berücksichtigen, die für den automatischen Abruf vorgesehen sind, wobei dies selbst bei gesetzten Haken nicht zuverlässig funktioniert. Dieses Verhalten ist weder dokumentiert noch für den Benutzer nachvollziehbar.

Fazit: Der bisher etablierte Workflow „manuell alle POP3-Konten abrufen“ ist in aktuellen Thunderbird-Versionen faktisch nicht mehr nutzbar. Für langjährige POP3-Nutzer ist das eine massive Verschlechterung der Bedienbarkeit.

Ist dieses Verhalten beabsichtigt (Designentscheidung) oder handelt es sich um eine Regression? Falls beabsichtigt: Warum gibt es keinen Ersatz für den früheren selektiven/globalen Abruf?
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/144.0.0.0 Safari/537.36;os:WIN 10 vor dem Umstieg auf WIN 11;kb_visits_prior:["/de/kb/unaufgeforderte-verbindungen-thunderbird"];solver_id:7364294

title: Frozen when receiving emails
creator: cpaveglio
content: When I am working from home, on my home network, and using a VPN, (Windows 11) whenever I receive new messages, the app becomes completely frozen. That is, if the app is in the background and I receive an email "bing bong" notification, I can go to the app, but I can not click on anything. Nothing responds. I cannot change tabs, select a message, move the window, or even use the close box to quit the application. I must force quit via the Windows tray icon. If I open the application and it immediately checks for messages and gets new messages, also I can not interact with any on-screen window or element. I must force quit. Then, after force quitting, I reopen again, and get no new messages, the previously new messages I can click on and read. So at no time can I get messages, and continue using the app. I also had a draft email in progress, and received new messages, and then the draft message was non interactive. When I tried to quit the app, I saw a popup message about saving the draft, but also could not click on it. This problem does not happen at work on my internal network and no VPN. Our email is all POP based (yes you read that right, all POP no IMAP), FWIW.
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:147.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/147.0;os:Windows 11 pro 25H2, Tbird 140.7.0esr 64bit

title: Display Header Info On Message View
creator: jesse21
content:
I copy/paste emails a lot for my job, which needs to include from, sent, to, cc, bcc, and subject:

From: Sender <sender@email.com>; Sent: Wednesday, January 21, 2026 at 11:27 AM EST To: John Doe <johndoe@email.com>; Cc: Jane Doe <janedoe@email.com>; Bcc: Subject: Email Subject

Currently, I am using the plugin ReplyWithHeader, which will produce this style of header on reply/forward, but is there a way to display this in the email body on view, without me having to reply/forward to produce the headers in the email body?

title: Tab indents multiple spaces, backspace only does 1 space at a time
creator: rstagerclan
content:
In Windows and other applications when I hit space it moves the cursor or text I have the cursor in front of to the right a certain number of spaces. If I subsequently hit backspace it moves the cursor or text I have the cursor in front of back the same amount of spaces.

This is not how Thunderbird operates, if I tab the cursor or text I have the cursor in front of does move to the right 2 spaces, but when I hit backspace the cursor or text I have the cursor in front of moves back a single space at a time.

1) Is there a setting that I can change to have backspace move the cursor or text I have the cursor in front of the same distance back as the initial "tab" moved it to the right?

2) Can I adjust the number of space "tab" jumps from 2 to say, 4?

Thanks

content: How can I retrieve emails I deleted by selecting wrong parameters in the wrong area. I was in Thunderbird > Acct Settings > Synchronization & Storage and saw "Disk Space" settings. Without thinking I selected --> O ... Delete messages more than [ xxx ] [ ^v ] days old and I changed the number to... [ 90 ] days old. Like an idiot, I for some reason thought I was dealing with messages in "Trash"... go figure. So of course I then noticed in my email Accounts... all messages older than 90 days were removed from all of my folders I had set-up. Many of the folders are now blank, empty of emails that I had moved into the separate folders set-up for different information. I've explored tons of solution responses in "Support" but haven't found a solution to my problem. I really need my older emails back... please help! , Ron.
